thread.title: Elderly man arrested in drug bust
thread.title_full: Elderly man arrested in drug bust

title: Elderly man arrested in drug bust
text:
Share on Twitter 
AN 80-YEAR-OLD farmer is one of three men arrested and charged for allegedly cultivating $5.5 million worth of cannabis in northwest NSW. 
Police from the Griffith Local Area Command working with the State Drug Squad yesterday uncovered 2,500 cannabis plants during a raid of a farm on Males Rd in Coolinroobie, near Griffith. 
Police said the cannabis has an estimated street value of $5.5 million. 
A 47-year-old man, 54-year-old man and 80-year-old man were arrested at the farm and taken to Griffith Police Station where they were charged with cultivating large commercial quantity of prohibited plants. 
Land titles show the 80-year-old is the owner of the farm. 
During the search the officers also found two shots guns, two rifles, ammunition and a sum of cash. 
All men were refused bail and are due to appear in Griffith local court today. 
IN OTHER NEWS: AU NSW: Journalists Pretend to be Riot Police in Hilarious Role Reversal Exercise February 22 0:33 
Police turned the tables on a group of Newcastle journalists, who were kitted out in riot gear and ?attacked? by police pretending to be ?angry mock demonstrators?. Police stated the six journalists were touring the facility as a part of a policing awareness program, and said the fake riot was a ?highlight?. The journalists were given batons, special boots, riot shields, helmets and eye protection. The police seemed delighted to be able to hand over their jobs ? for a moment at least! Credit: NSW Police Force via Storyful February 23rd 2017
